Author: JaeHee Park
Review: Higashi honganji is not UNESCO heritage but also beautifel and huge temple. Resembles to nishihonganji.

Author: Jonathan Dempsey
Review: A little more touristy than other temples but still beautiful to see. Very serene with great architecture

Author: Craig Smith
Review: Higashi Hongan-ji is a large temple in Kyoto but is often not as busy as some of the others. It gives you a real sense of the importance of religion to the Japanese.

Author: Chien Chai Lye
Review:
A big Pureland Buddhist temple in Kyoto. Within walking distance from Kyoto Station Hachijo side. Two main halls - founder's hall and Amida hall.

It is a quiet and serene place. Not too touristy.

Author: Ali Low
Review: One of the largest temples in Kyoto, a short distance from station.  It's really worth visiting especially as it's free.  The size of the buildings is really amazing to see.  A major restoration of the main hall has recently finished as it was covered for a number of years.

Author: Lai
Review: Picturesque tranquillity in a historical setting. The temple has been rebuilt following several fires and people have died to build this temple as they had to bring down wood from mountainous regions of Japan. This gives you an extra layer of appreciation to the quiet awe you experience once you enter the premises. It's free as they say and it was very quiet even on a Sunday afternoon. You need to put your shoes in a plastic bag before going into any of the buildings. This keeps everything clean and no pictures inside as it's a space of worship. There is also a small gallery with pictures.

Author: Markos Moreno
Review: Had the pleasure of witnessing a Buddhist ceremony that was in progress. Sometimes just sitting and meditating does wonders for a person's spirit. I know it did for me.

Author: Karl Mohan (Kalash)
Review: I came here a few times during my stay at Kyoto. This temple is one of the largest wooden structures in Japan with unique carvings. If you are up to it, attend the early morning service around 6am where buddhist monks do some chanting. A truly unique experience

Author: Kenny Lin
Review: Very similar layout to Ë•øÊú¨È°òÂØ∫. I like the hall and hallway of the temple. It you are there, take off shoes and step on it.

Author: Hien Ngo
Review: One of the largest wood structures in the world. The pagoda is truly immense and a must see in Kyoto

Author: Julio De la Fuente S. (jufusa)
Review:
Best architectural design of a temple in Kyoto. Of course, my opinion.

I was there like 30 minutes and it was closing, but only to see the inside is breathtaking.

Author: Dominik Kuthan
Review: Perfect and breathtaking place! Enormous shrine with sort of garden-looking komplex. Gigantic main temple and it's atmosphere is even more serene that any other shrine in Kyoto, at least for me. You even need to take off your shoes to walk there! And no camera while inside. Great about this place is it's location, basicaly in very short walking distance from Kyoto JR station. Must see if you are in Kyoto!

Author: Kartika Puspita Sari
Review: One of registered cultural properties in Japan. Great and beautiful traditional architecture embedded with modern earthquake mitigation technology. This amazing massive temple site is very close to Kyoto Station. Please have a visit if you are nearby the station.

Author: Melanie C
Review: The architecture is beautiful. Black on gold, haven't seen a temple like this before. Great place to take photos too!

Author: Dom H
Review: Absolutely stunning. Provide a sense of awe at the monumental building. Exquisite architecture. Entrance is free. 10 minutes walk from the main station.

Author: Mi≈Çosz Wawrzyniec Romaniuk
Review: Large temple in the centre of the city of Kyoto. Well preserved, big buildings in which you can not take photos. Calm and silent despite of closeness to the city. Just visit it and have a while of serenity during your trip around the city. You can also buy some souvenirs in the temple's shop or get provided stamps white the temple's signature in your notebook.

Author: J. Eisenbeis
Review: Awesome temple complex close to Kyoto station. Can be reached easily by feet from Kyoto station in less than 10 minutes. The temples are allowed to enter without shoes but for free. This temple complex is definitely worth to visit and only takes about half an hour to see everything.

Author: Kyoto Luggage Delivery Komatsu
Review: This huge temple is located just 5 minutes walk from Kyoto station! You cannot miss this place when you come to Kyoto!

Author: Todd Hooper
Review: The temple building here is huge. There is no fee to enter the grounds, so it‚Äôs worth checking out if you are in the area.

Author: Taylor
Review: So impressive! What a beautiful temple and grounds. Though it is so large and impressive it still felt very comforting and peaceful to me. I would recommend a visit.

Author: ÎØºÎèÑÏÇ¨
Review:
I didn't notice there is a temple. It was unexpected, but it was so great structure.
Beautiful gold and huge size.. You should go there!!

Author: Dhruv Parmar
Review: This Temple is enormous and well kept after its last restoration some 200 years ago. It's hard to believe people were able to build something so massive without the help of modern day construction equipment.

Author: Isha Bista
Review: Minutes from Kyoto station. Huge grounds, very peaceful and amazing architecture. Must visit if it near to Kyoto station. Entry is free.two temples inside the ground and the outside gate is very picturesque too

Author: K Krisno
Review: A lot of reasons to visit this shrine. Closed to Kyoto Station.Beautiful Temple. Free. Not very crowded when I visit.

Author: Mika Koivisto
Review:
My favourite temple by far. Every time I am in Kyoto this is part of the agenda no matter how tight it is.

It is only a good five minutes walk from the Kyoto station so it is very conveniently located. Now finally the restauration of 10+ years has been finished so you can actually see the whole facade of both of the main temples in its full glory.

No entrance fee, so you don‚Äôt have a reason not to visit here.

Author: Benjamin de Leon
Review: Absolutely stunning in the early morning. The complex was vast and complemented the blue sky when I visited.

Author: June Ang
Review: Amazingly serene temple with gorgeous details after renovations/restorations.  They included historical items along the corridor like the hair rope donated by women of various regions to tie the ceiling beams as hair was much stronger than the straw ropes of that time.

Author: g olivan
Review: You don't really.read about this temple anywhere, probably because historically don't have much to say, but it is a very beautiful, quite and easy to reach temple. just 5 minutes walking from Kyoto station. verily nice, dont miss it

Author: Corleon
Review:
Great walk and closed from Kyoto station üöâ and it‚Äôs a huge temple.
Better arrive before 4pm because the inner court will close.

Author: Matthew Werder
Review: Really cool and calming temple.  It is pretty massive and a number of places inside to explore.  It won‚Äôt take you more than 30 minutes to see the whole place.  The gift shop is nothing big nor does have much to offer.  There is no entrance fee and when we went there was few people.  Check it and remember to take your shoes off!

Author: Marcel Molendijk
Review: Huge temple that was last restored at the end of the 19th century. Free admission. You can park your bicycle in front of the main building.

Author: Filippo Basagni
Review: Huge and majestic. Really nice to visit and for some pic of the outside. Inside the temple there is a guard that will intimate you to stop taking pictures. Overall a carateristic place to see, expecially because it's free

Author: Andy Nguyen
Review: The temple is very beautiful. You do have to take off your shoes when you want to enter where the monks pray. But the floors are comfortable to walk barefooted on.

Author: Charles-E. Kirihara S.
Review: If you want a peaceful walk free of charge... Come over to Higashi-Honganji Temple. Remember to remove your shoes before entering the Temple. It's maybe a 20-30 minute sightseeing if you're relatively quick. If you're into collecting those stamps, there's 3 stamp areas for your journal around the Temple.

Author: T C
Review:
This place is second to none.  On my on my!

The temple is huge!  One of the largest, if not the largest wooden structure in the world.

Definitely a "hidden" gem....... You really can't tell how big this temple is from the outside.  Photos cannot do justice.

Recommended to go any time but do spend some time inside the building.  Its great place to meditate.  Don't rush.

I can spend whole day.... If there weren't Yodobashi camera 2 minutes away.

Bring your super wide angle lens!

Author: Diana M
Review: Higashi-Honganji is most likely my favorite temple I visited so far in Japan. I don't think I have ever felt before such a strong sense of tranquility as when my feet touched the cold wooden floor of the temple. It's a moment I will never forget and I wish I could have stayed there for a long, long time.

Author: Hung Cat
Review: The Temple is very calming and peaceful as there didn't seem to be overly busy. Public transport makes it easy to get there as the buses stop right outside it. We went in late August and certain parts were closed due to restoration works but the rest of the Temple was spectacular

Author: Kristy Marques
Review: It is free to enter. You just need to remove your shoes and put them into a plastic bag start in the one infront of you and go clockwise. The detailing is very beautiful. It is very peaceful inside. Make sure to be quiet in respect for those who are praying. There are a few bathrooms on premises and you can walk here from Kyoto station.

Author: Chris Wyatt
Review: Amazing architecture. Close tobKyotonstation. So it's an easy visit of you are between trains for an hour or so. Heck, even book a break to make a visit. There is a peer temple located several blocks off, but this is the one tonviisot if time is constrained.

Author: Jason Warner
Review: Beautiful and calming.  We came with our family and our host. It was under construction in sections but they maintained the elegance.  Do stop in and see the history.

Author: Peter Alexander
Review: Big temple, beautiful, free admission, quiet, beautiful construction, good atmosphere, if coming to Kyoto, must come here

Author: pham huyen
Review: This Buddhist temple is so beautiful and calming with special architecture, there are locks for luggage and trolley. It is also very near Kyoto station, and it is free to visit as well:)

Author: Mira Wijaya
Review: This is such an underrated place! It's gigantic and gorgeous. Only few visitors at 9.30 am before a group of school students come. Very close to Kyoto Station and Kyoto Tower.

Author: Christine Lu
Review: A world heritage temple that is free to visit and never crowded.  Both buildings and the compound with a 400 year old ginkgo tree worth a visit.

Author: Preechaya Rattanadilokchai (Tonson)
Review: Quite possibly one of the highlights of our trip. It's a hidden (from tourists) gem. Given the amazing architecture and spiritual vibe the place has, it's quite surprising how little tourists there are. Although the area open for visit (as of 2020) are quite small, and you could probably cover the whole place in under 20 minutes, it has quite a charm to it. Definitely a must go, especially before more tourists come to the place. Just hang around and appreciate the place ;)

Author: Deb Tryzbiak
Review: Another very beautiful temple in Kyoto. Several buildings covering a large area. Very pretty carvings on the temple and just stunning inside (no pictures allowed inside). It's not too far of a walk from other temples, as well, so we were able to see this one and Sanjusangendo.

Author: RTrev3
Review: A beautiful and large temple complex in the heart of Kyoto.  There is so much to see and experience, I recommend that you give yourself a few hours to visit here, there is so much.  There are multiple temple for praying, there‚Äôs also a museum with theater for you to sit and learn about it‚Äôs history.  It was a great learning experience and quite fun.

Author: Sonia Z
Review: It was a quick walk from Kyoto station. Very peaceful and the view was great.

Author: Aana
Review: Nice place very near to Kyoto station. Loved the architecture. Beware you can‚Äôt take pics inside the temple coz you can find the Japanese praying inside. So make sure not to disturb them!

Author: Latifa DNI
Review: Biggest temple I've ever visit! The black-gold color of this temple makes it look so grand and beautiful. I've spent several hours here sitting on their court, and enjoying the spring breeze. I will definitely visit this temple again

Author: Sean Kamki
Review: Close to Kyoto Station, with free admission, this temple is 1 of the best place to begin with for your travel to Kyoto. This temple is the headquarter of 1 of the biggest Buddhism denominations, with huge beautiful halls and gates in a traditional architectural style, and the most remarkably it's always kept clean. There's also a resting place and Buddhist goods shop in the temple compound. You can take a rest and maybe find some unusual Buddhist souvenirs.

Author: Mochammad Tiar Risandi
Review: An amazing wooden structure! Was lucky enough to witness a prayer or ritual inside the temple. With such massive structure but heavenly quite inside, it feels like I have transported to another plane! It is also close to Kyoto Station which is convenient when you want to visit!

Author: AMY M
Review: Such a beautiful temple in Kyoto. My favorite part was one of 'wise saying' displayed by temple. '„Åì„Çå„Åã„Çâ„Åå „Åì„Çå„Åæ„Åß„Çí„Åç„ÇÅ„Çã' was touching my heart.  I took it as 'It doesn't matter what you did or who you were until now. It matters only what you are gonna do and who you are gonna be from now on.' I used to live in Japan when I was in early 20s. Hope I wasn't wrong.

Author: R.W. Sinclair
Review: Amazing, huge temple complex. Still an active place of worship so be respectful.

Author: Mike H
Review:
Beautiful temple located close to the station. Largest total wooden structure in the world. üåé
Very peaceful place to unwind and contemplate.

Author: Ramesh Hariharan
Review: Must stop by spot. Beautiful temple and it's surroundings then during 2001. Easily accessible from station. Vast space, neat and tidy. Ideal location to meditate and pray.

Author: Rich Campbell
Review: Wow! Just Wow! The architecture of this Temple is outstanding.

Author: Zinnia Xu
Review: Beautiful serene temple in the middle of Kyoto. The ginkgo trees are absolutely beautiful this time of year (Nov 2022)

Author: Jayson Lindsley
Review: This place is quiet, not much to do but think and take in the sights. Still, very tranquil.

Author: Mark Drotar
Review: Amazing place. Free to visit and you can walk around inside. The scale is impressive and the buildings are very ornate. It doesn't seem like it's that busy, but this was 200% better than the imperial palace in Kyoto.

Author: Spanya Uawithya
Review: 30 Nov. Nice place with yellow ginkgo leaf.

Author: Steve Binversie
Review: Easy walk from Kyoto Station.   No admission fee.

Author: Ky Lee
Review: Beautiful place to stop by. Walking distance from Kyoto train station

Author: Timothy HALL
Review: Nice ornate temple grounds with massive buildings.

Author: Kai McCaughey
Review: Beautiful piece of culture.  Just go  take it in and listen to the surrounding energy and peace. Take a breath and prey to whatever you believe in while you're there listening to their hymns and stop for a moment. It's worth it

Author: Howard Nash
Review: Huge, well maintained temple. East 6-10 min walk from Kyoto station. The history is awe inspiring.

Author: Gaku ‚ÄúGK‚Äù Kamitani
Review: Quite good and big buddhist temple. This place is open for everybody from early morning and quite good place to enjoy the atmosphere of the historic city of Kyoto. It is located within 5 to 10 minute walking distance from Kyoto station, so it is good to visit in the last hour of your stay in Kyoto.

Author: Ter C
Review: Majestic and spacious temple. Will need to remove shoes (plastic bag provided at  entrance of main building) and great feel of tranquillity once entered. The altar and  structures look grand, but either it is slightly too "restored" or very well preserved. I do recommend paying a visit if you have extra time (probably 30 mins to 45 mins) when stopping by near to kyoto station. Within walking distance from the station. Oh and wheel chair accessible :)

Author: Tom Lee
Review:
One of the best temples in Kyoto.
You can go inside.
Takes about 15-30 minutes to look around.

Author: Ethan Sheridan
Review: this might be one of my favorite shrines to see it's hard to grasp how large and intricate this site is. everything is restored perfectly, and any restoration was done with original methods by hand. I highly recommend this to anyone in the city. Make sure you stop here and see the whole area

Author: Damien Shost
Review:
üìøüõê A stunning temple just around Kyoto main station.

It is unbelievable that it is for free.

When I went (february 2023) it was almost empty, so it is great if you don‚Äôt like crowds. I enjoyed it more than the most typical turistic places where
you can barely stand among so many people.

Notice that it is currently with works, so it is noisy at times and not so beautiful in some areas.

100% recommended.

Author: Kingston Obike
Review: An architectural marvel a few minutes away from Kyoto station. The moment you walk right in you‚Äôd come to appreciate the little details right from the very gate to the open field of neatly placed gravel and the two main large buildings overlooking that rocky field. Entry is free and you‚Äôre required to take off your shoes. For anyone with a particular interest in the Japanese architecture of old, I highly recommend a visit to this temple.

Author: Capucine Vivant
Review: It was raining and the grounds are being renovated at the moment so it was not prime conditions to enjoy it to it's full glory but that will still blow your mind. The scale, the craftsmanship, the solemn peace of the place. Totally worth it especially when the renovations will be completed.

Author: Mark Whitehead
Review: Excellent, don't let the proximity to the station put you off. Well worth a visit as its free, worth following the signs for the garden after as well

Author: Jeffrey Fawcett
Review: Probably the most beautiful temple I've seen in Kyoto so far. And a quick walk from Kyoto Station makes it a must.

Author: Xin Ying Chen
Review: prayer was in session while we were there. very serene place to just walk around and clear your mind

Author: David
Review: Impressive scale & colors.

Author: Linggi 7
Review: Several large temples and sprawling grounds make for a worthwhile visit, even with tour groups lurking. Has amenities, cafe and even a children's playground spread out. Nice place to stroll and meditate.

Author: MWP
Review: Incredible architecture and history, only a few minutes walk from Kyoto Station. We visited right before Hana Matsuri, so there were lots of preparations for the festival. Wear slip-on shoes!

Author: Jason
Review: Unique Buddhist event going on when we went. Super beautiful and everyone was very respectful.

Author: Yosafat Dhimas
Review: A huge temple just walk 5 min from Kyoto Station

Author: April Hudson
Review: Really interesting and beautiful temple! Really enjoyed visiting early in the morning.

Author: Guy Hefferin
Review: Extensive and well-maintained temple complex with some excellent choral singing during our visit.

Author: Adam Rowe
Review: This is a beautiful place. Have a look, it is not hard to find spirituality.

Author: Nagy Bela
Review: Wonderful place. I am glad i could to visit there. I will back once a time

Author: Melisa Abuin
Review: Beautiful temple super close to the station. I recommend going in and seeing it inside, it helps you understand a little more about the culture of this beautiful country

Author: Matt Mohr
Review: Awesome Temple in downtown Kyoto. Very easy to get to, no charge to explore. Just don't take photos in the indoor sections because it's disrespectful (outside is ok).

Author: M. ZGN
Review: By far most spectacular temple that l have visited.

Author: Damian Holda
Review: Really impressive and monumental temple, especially recommend due to closeness to station. Its easy to visit on the way and it does make impression

Author: Arun Vishwanathan
Review:
Lovely and peaceful Temple that always gives me some amazing peace of mind.

Don‚Äôt miss it if you come to Kyoto

Author: Cecile A
Review: We passed by this Buddhist shrine after visiting the more well-known ones. This one spoke to me, so I was compelled to go into the complex. The energy coming from the very large and beautifully sculpted dark wooden buildings was so compelling. I went inside the prayer shrine and prayed for compassion, social justice and creative problem solving for my dysfunctional country‚Äîthe US.

Author: Taylah Bons
Review:
üèØ UNDERWHELMING BUT STILL BEAUTIFUL üèØ
I don‚Äôt regret having visited this temple, however I wouldn‚Äôt return. The architecture is gorgeous and the temple itself is peaceful. However the Gallery is completely lacklustre and there really isn‚Äôt much to see on the grounds other than the main temple itself.

Author: Frank Abernethy
Review: One of the nicer temples you can visit freely in the heart of Kyoto.

Author: Jay Swmfl
Review:
This is a hidden gem of Kyoto and something I'd not seen on the internet hype videos of the same places you must go.
This is authentic Buddhist temple which is not only beautiful to look at, but has 2 massive wooden buildings - breath taking

Author: Ron Vega
Review: What a beautiful temple. Very calming, quiet and zen.  There are some areas under construction but still worth going.

Author: Lucas Chew
Review: Higashi Hongan-Ji Temple was beautiful and serene. Free to enter, it‚Äôs central gravel courtyard is grand and well maintained. Must-dos include taking off your shoes to enter the main hall. Take a seated moment on the tatami mat floors and soak in the moment, you won‚Äôt regret it! Overall, a peaceful and pretty place to visit, just a little down from Kyoto Station. Enjoy~

Author: Joy Bose
Review: A beautiful temple of jodo shinshu. Rebuilt in 1890s after the previous temple burnt down in an accident. Must visit

Author: Jenny Swallow
Review: Like everything else in Japan this place was clean, tidy and well organised; As well being absolutely stunning

Author: Norifumi Sekiguchi
Review: Sacred temple near KYOTO station

Author: Phil Sefton
Review: Choose to the station. Well worth a visit. Free.
